jurisdiction_rules.rule_text: Unless otherwise ordered, motions, oppositions, and replies shall not exceed 25, 25, and 15 pages respectively, exclusive of tables and exhibits.
Before filing any discovery motion, the moving party must first make a good faith effort to meet and confer with the opposing party to resolve the dispute.
Motions may be decided without oral argument. A party desiring oral argument must file a separate request stating why oral argument would be helpful.
All papers shall be 8Â½ by 11 inches in size, with margins of at least one inch on all sides. Text shall be double-spaced, except for quotations and footnotes.
Prior to making any motion relating to discovery, counsel must request a pre-motion conference with the Court by letter.
Memoranda of law in support of or in opposition to motions shall not exceed 25 pages without prior permission.
Memoranda in support of and in opposition to a motion shall not exceed 35 pages. Reply memoranda shall not exceed 20 pages.
Discovery motions shall be filed as Joint Stipulations containing each party's contentions and a proposed order.
Unless otherwise directed, the response to a motion shall be filed within 21 days. A reply may be filed within 14 days.
In patent cases, parties must comply with the Patent Rules which require disclosure of asserted claims and infringement contentions.
Opening and answering briefs shall not exceed 30 pages. Reply briefs shall not exceed 15 pages.
Parties are expected to resolve discovery disputes informally. The Court will entertain discovery motions only after good faith efforts to resolve have failed.
A memorandum of points and authorities in support of or in opposition to a motion must not exceed 15 pages.
Papers must be typewritten in at least 12-point type, double-spaced, with 1.5-inch left margin and 1-inch margins elsewhere.
A motion relating to discovery must be accompanied by a declaration stating facts showing a reasonable and good faith attempt at informal resolution.
A motion shall be noticed to be heard at a time not more than 60 days after the date of mailing of the notice of motion.
Prior to making a discovery motion, counsel must confer in a good faith effort to resolve all disputes about disclosure.
Absent court order, memoranda of law shall be limited to 25 pages.
Every pleading, plea, motion, or application must be filed with the clerk by delivering it to the clerk or by electronic filing if available.
Parties must confer regarding discovery before seeking court intervention. The motion must state that counsel has conferred.
All pleadings must be signed by an attorney and contain the attorney's Florida Bar number, address, telephone number, and email address.
Before filing any motion relating to discovery, the movant shall confer with counsel for the opposing party in a good faith effort to resolve the issues.
Motions shall be accompanied by a memorandum of law not exceeding 15 pages. Response memoranda shall not exceed 15 pages. Replies shall not exceed 5 pages.
Before filing any discovery motion, counsel shall confer in person or by telephone in a good faith effort to resolve the dispute.
Memoranda in support of and in opposition to dispositive motions shall not exceed 20 pages. Non-dispositive motions shall not exceed 10 pages.
